questions.answer: Limb-kinetic apraxia symptoms include loss of fine motor skills, clumsiness with precise movements, difficulty with finger movements, affects one hand typically, and inability to perform skilled movements.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of buccofacial apraxia?
questions.answer: Buccofacial apraxia symptoms include difficulty performing facial movements on command, can perform spontaneously, difficulty pretending to blow out candle, difficulty showing how to use straw, preserved automatic facial movements.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of anosognosia?
questions.answer: Anosognosia symptoms include denial of illness or disability, lack of insight into deficits, resistance to treatment, poor safety awareness, frustration from caregivers, and common after right brain damage.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of Anton syndrome?
questions.answer: Anton syndrome symptoms include cortical blindness, denial of blindness, confabulation about what they see, bumping into objects, falling, and associated with bilateral occipital lobe damage.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of Capgras syndrome?
questions.answer: Capgras syndrome symptoms include belief that familiar person is an imposter, recognition of physical similarity, insistence imposter replaced real person, paranoia, agitation, and associated with dementia or psychosis.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of Fregoli syndrome?
questions.answer: Fregoli syndrome symptoms include belief that different people are same person in disguise, paranoid delusions, belief person is persecuting them, anxiety, and rare delusional disorder.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of Cotard syndrome?
questions.answer: Cotard syndrome symptoms include belief that one is dead, belief internal organs missing, denial of self-existence, refusing to eat, severe depression, and rare psychiatric disorder.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of Kluver-Bucy syndrome?
questions.answer: Kluver-Bucy syndrome symptoms include placing objects in mouth excessively, hypersexuality, visual agnosia, emotional blunting, hyperorality, dietary changes, and caused by bilateral temporal lobe damage.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of Balint syndrome?
questions.answer: Balint syndrome symptoms include simultanagnosia (seeing only one object at time), optic ataxia (difficulty reaching for objects under visual guidance), ocular apraxia (difficulty shifting gaze), and bilateral parietal lobe damage.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of Korsakoff psychosis?
questions.answer: Korsakoff psychosis symptoms include severe memory impairment, confabulation, lack of insight, apathy, minimal spontaneous conversation, preserved long-term memory initially, and caused by thiamine deficiency.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of delirium?
questions.answer: Delirium symptoms include acute confusion, fluctuating awareness, disorientation, attention problems, hallucinations, agitation or lethargy, disorganized thinking, and sleep-wake cycle disturbance.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of confusional state?
questions.answer: Confusional state symptoms include disorientation, difficulty focusing attention, impaired memory, slow thinking, fluctuating awareness, difficulty with complex tasks, and acute or subacute onset.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of stupor?
questions.answer: Stupor symptoms include markedly reduced responsiveness, minimal spontaneous movement, responds only to vigorous stimulation, appears dazed, decreased awareness, and indicates severe brain dysfunction.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of coma?
questions.answer: Coma symptoms include complete unresponsiveness, no awareness of surroundings, no purposeful responses, eyes remain closed, no sleep-wake cycles, and requires life support in many cases.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of minimally conscious state?
questions.answer: Minimally conscious state symptoms include inconsistent but reproducible responses, can follow simple commands sometimes, minimal awareness, purposeful movements occasionally, visual tracking, and better prognosis than vegetative state.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of persistent vegetative state?
questions.answer: Persistent vegetative state symptoms include wakefulness without awareness, sleep-wake cycles present, no meaningful responses, reflexive movements only, no language comprehension, and lasting over one month.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of brain death?
questions.answer: Brain death symptoms include complete absence of brain function, no spontaneous breathing, no brainstem reflexes, no response to stimulation, pupils fixed and dilated, and legally considered death.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of sleep paralysis?
questions.answer: Sleep paralysis symptoms include temporary inability to move or speak, occurs when falling asleep or waking, feeling of pressure on chest, hallucinations, fear or panic, and lasting seconds to minutes.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of REM sleep behavior disorder?
questions.answer: REM sleep behavior disorder symptoms include acting out dreams, violent movements during sleep, talking or shouting, injuries to self or bed partner, vivid dream recall, and loss of normal REM atonia.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of sleepwalking?
questions.answer: Sleepwalking symptoms include walking during sleep, sitting up in bed, performing complex activities, blank expression, difficult to wake, no memory of event, and occurs during deep sleep.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of night terrors?
questions.answer: Night terrors symptoms include sudden screaming or crying, intense fear, sweating and rapid breathing, difficult to wake or console, no memory of event, and occurs during deep sleep in children.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of nightmare disorder?
questions.answer: Nightmare disorder symptoms include frequent disturbing dreams, awakening from sleep, clear recall of dream, difficulty returning to sleep, daytime distress, and occurs during REM sleep.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of circadian rhythm sleep disorder?
questions.answer: Circadian rhythm sleep disorder symptoms include difficulty falling asleep at desired time, difficulty waking at desired time, excessive sleepiness, insomnia, impaired daytime functioning, and misalignment with environment.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of delayed sleep phase disorder?
questions.answer: Delayed sleep phase disorder symptoms include inability to fall asleep until late, difficulty waking in morning, normal sleep when allowed to follow preferred schedule, chronic sleep deprivation, and daytime sleepiness.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of advanced sleep phase disorder?
questions.answer: Advanced sleep phase disorder symptoms include falling asleep very early evening, waking very early morning, inability to stay awake evening, normal sleep duration and quality, and difficulty with social activities.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of non-24-hour sleep-wake disorder?
questions.answer: Non-24-hour sleep-wake disorder symptoms include sleep times shifting later each day, periods of insomnia alternating with sleepiness, difficulty maintaining schedule, most common in blind individuals, and free-running circadian rhythm.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of shift work sleep disorder?
questions.answer: Shift work sleep disorder symptoms include excessive sleepiness during work hours, insomnia when trying to sleep, reduced sleep duration, fatigue, difficulty concentrating, and related to work schedule.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of jet lag disorder?
questions.answer: Jet lag disorder symptoms include difficulty sleeping at night, excessive sleepiness during day, difficulty concentrating, fatigue, mood changes, gastrointestinal problems, and occurs after rapid travel across time zones.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of hypersomnia?
questions.answer: Hypersomnia symptoms include excessive daytime sleepiness despite adequate nighttime sleep, prolonged nighttime sleep, difficulty waking, sleep drunkenness, unrefreshing naps, cognitive impairment, and difficulty with daily activities.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of idiopathic hypersomnia?
questions.answer: Idiopathic hypersomnia symptoms include excessive daytime sleepiness, prolonged nighttime sleep (10+ hours), difficulty waking, sleep inertia (grogginess), unrefreshing naps, automatic behaviors, and no other cause found.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of Klein-Levin syndrome?
questions.answer: Klein-Levin syndrome symptoms include recurrent episodes of excessive sleepiness (days to weeks), cognitive impairment, altered perception, compulsive eating, hypersexuality, normal between episodes, and most common in adolescent males.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of cataplexy?
questions.answer: Cataplexy symptoms include sudden loss of muscle tone, triggered by strong emotions (laughter, surprise), consciousness maintained, lasting seconds to minutes, jaw dropping, knee buckling, and associated with narcolepsy.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of parasomnia?
questions.answer: Parasomnia symptoms include abnormal behaviors during sleep, complex movements, vocalizations, confusion upon awakening, no memory of event, injury potential, and occurs during specific sleep stages.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of exploding head syndrome?
questions.answer: Exploding head syndrome symptoms include hearing loud noise when falling asleep or waking, sound like explosion or crash, no pain, flash of light sometimes, sudden awakening, anxiety, and harmless condition.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of sleep-related eating disorder?
questions.answer: Sleep-related eating disorder symptoms include eating during partial arousal from sleep, no memory of eating, unusual food choices, weight gain, injuries from food preparation, and feeling unrested.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of sexsomnia?
questions.answer: Sexsomnia symptoms include sexual behaviors during sleep, no awareness during episode, no memory of event, confusion upon awakening, normal sexual function when awake, and potential relationship problems.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of bruxism?
questions.answer: Bruxism symptoms include teeth grinding during sleep, jaw clenching, tooth wear, jaw pain, headache, ear pain, disrupted sleep, and often unaware unless told by bed partner.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of periodic limb movement disorder?
questions.answer: Periodic limb movement disorder symptoms include repetitive limb movements during sleep, leg jerking or twitching, disrupted sleep, daytime sleepiness, usually unaware of movements, and bed partner notices.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of obstructive sleep apnea?
questions.answer: Obstructive sleep apnea symptoms include loud snoring, breathing pauses during sleep, gasping or choking, morning headache, daytime sleepiness, irritability, difficulty concentrating, and high blood pressure.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of central sleep apnea?
questions.answer: Central sleep apnea symptoms include breathing pauses during sleep, awakening short of breath, difficulty staying asleep, excessive daytime sleepiness, morning headaches, difficulty concentrating, and mood changes.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of Cheyne-Stokes respiration?
questions.answer: Cheyne-Stokes respiration symptoms include cyclical pattern of breathing (crescendo-decrescendo), periods of no breathing, gasping, awakening with shortness of breath, excessive daytime sleepiness, and associated with heart failure.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of sleep-related hypoventilation?
questions.answer: Sleep-related hypoventilation symptoms include morning headaches, daytime sleepiness, difficulty concentrating, memory problems, elevated CO2 levels, shortness of breath, and worsens during sleep.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of obesity hypoventilation syndrome?
questions.answer: Obesity hypoventilation syndrome symptoms include daytime sleepiness, fatigue, morning headaches, difficulty breathing, elevated CO2, low oxygen, heart problems, and BMI over 30.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of congenital central hypoventilation syndrome?
questions.answer: Congenital central hypoventilation syndrome symptoms include shallow breathing during sleep, cyanosis (blue color), requires ventilator support, autonomic nervous system dysfunction, present from birth, and life-threatening.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of panic disorder?
questions.answer: Panic disorder symptoms include recurrent panic attacks, intense fear, rapid heartbeat, sweating, trembling, shortness of breath, chest pain, nausea, dizziness, fear of losing control or dying.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of generalized anxiety disorder?
questions.answer: Generalized anxiety disorder symptoms include excessive worry about various topics, restlessness, fatigue, difficulty concentrating, irritability, muscle tension, sleep problems, and symptoms present most days for 6+ months.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of social anxiety disorder?
questions.answer: Social anxiety disorder symptoms include intense fear of social situations, fear of judgment, avoidance of social events, blushing, sweating, trembling, nausea, difficulty speaking, and interference with daily life.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of specific phobia?
questions.answer: Specific phobia symptoms include intense fear of specific object or situation, immediate anxiety response, avoidance behavior, recognition that fear is excessive, panic symptoms when exposed, and interference with life.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of agoraphobia?
questions.answer: Agoraphobia symptoms include fear of open spaces, crowds, public transportation, leaving home alone, panic attacks in these situations, avoidance behavior, dependency on others, and significant life impairment.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of separation anxiety disorder?
questions.answer: Separation anxiety disorder symptoms include excessive fear of separation from attachment figures, worry about harm to loved ones, reluctance to be alone, nightmares about separation, physical symptoms when separated, and distress.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of selective mutism?
questions.answer: Selective mutism symptoms include consistent failure to speak in specific situations, speaks normally in comfortable settings, interferes with education or social communication, lasts at least one month, and not due to lack of language knowledge.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of major depressive disorder?
questions.answer: Major depressive disorder symptoms include persistent sad mood, loss of interest in activities, weight changes, sleep changes, fatigue, feelings of worthlessness, difficulty concentrating, thoughts of death, and symptoms lasting 2+ weeks.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of persistent depressive disorder?
questions.answer: Persistent depressive disorder symptoms include depressed mood most of the day, poor appetite or overeating, low energy, low self-esteem, poor concentration, feelings of hopelessness, and symptoms lasting 2+ years.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of seasonal affective disorder?
questions.answer: Seasonal affective disorder symptoms include depression during specific season (usually winter), fatigue, increased sleep, weight gain, loss of interest in activities, social withdrawal, and symptoms improve in other seasons.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of premenstrual dysphoric disorder?
questions.answer: Premenstrual dysphoric disorder symptoms include mood swings, irritability, depressed mood, anxiety, week before period, decreased interest in activities, difficulty concentrating, fatigue, sleep changes, and physical symptoms.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of disruptive mood dysregulation disorder?
questions.answer: Disruptive mood dysregulation disorder symptoms include severe temper outbursts, irritable mood between outbursts, symptoms present in multiple settings, onset before age 10, and diagnosis between ages 6-18.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of bipolar I disorder?
questions.answer: Bipolar I disorder symptoms include manic episodes (elevated mood, increased energy, decreased need for sleep, risky behavior), possible depressive episodes, impaired functioning, and may include psychotic features.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of bipolar II disorder?
questions.answer: Bipolar II disorder symptoms include hypomanic episodes (less severe than mania), major depressive episodes, elevated mood and energy, increased activity, more talkative, and no psychotic features.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of cyclothymic disorder?
questions.answer: Cyclothymic disorder symptoms include numerous periods of hypomanic symptoms, numerous periods of depressive symptoms, symptoms not meeting full criteria for episodes, mood instability for 2+ years, and less severe than bipolar.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of rapid cycling bipolar disorder?
questions.answer: Rapid cycling bipolar disorder symptoms include four or more mood episodes per year, shifts between mania/hypomania and depression, brief periods of normal mood, difficult to treat, and more common in women.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of mixed episode?
questions.answer: Mixed episode symptoms include symptoms of mania and depression simultaneously, agitation, sleep problems, racing thoughts, depressed mood, hopelessness, high energy, and increased suicide risk.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of psychotic depression?
questions.answer: Psychotic depression symptoms include severe depression with psychotic features, hallucinations, delusions, paranoia, agitation, anxiety, physical immobility, inability to care for self, and high suicide risk.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of catatonia?
questions.answer: Catatonia symptoms include immobility, mutism, negativism, rigidity, posturing, grimacing, echolalia (repeating speech), echopraxia (repeating movements), and can occur with various psychiatric conditions.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of schizoaffective disorder?
questions.answer: Schizoaffective disorder symptoms include hallucinations, delusions, disorganized thinking, mood episodes (manic or depressive), psychotic symptoms without mood symptoms sometimes, and impaired functioning.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of delusional disorder?
questions.answer: Delusional disorder symptoms include one or more delusions lasting 1+ months, functioning not significantly impaired, behavior not obviously odd, no hallucinations (or brief), and apart from delusion relatively normal.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of brief psychotic disorder?
questions.answer: Brief psychotic disorder symptoms include sudden onset of psychotic symptoms (hallucinations, delusions, disorganized speech), lasting 1 day to 1 month, return to normal functioning, often triggered by stress.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of schizophreniform disorder?
questions.answer: Schizophreniform disorder symptoms include hallucinations, delusions, disorganized speech, disorganized behavior, negative symptoms, duration 1-6 months, and similar to schizophrenia but shorter duration.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of paranoid personality disorder?
questions.answer: Paranoid personality disorder symptoms include pervasive distrust of others, suspicion without basis, reluctance to confide, reads hidden meanings into remarks, holds grudges, quick to anger, doubts loyalty.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of schizoid personality disorder?
questions.answer: Schizoid personality disorder symptoms include detachment from social relationships, restricted emotional expression, preference for solitary activities, lack of close friends, indifference to praise or criticism, emotional coldness.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of schizotypal personality disorder?
questions.answer: Schizotypal personality disorder symptoms include odd beliefs or magical thinking, unusual perceptual experiences, eccentric behavior, paranoid ideation, inappropriate affect, few close friends, social anxiety, odd speech.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of antisocial personality disorder?
questions.answer: Antisocial personality disorder symptoms include disregard for rights of others, deceitfulness, impulsivity, irritability, reckless behavior, lack of remorse, consistent irresponsibility, and conduct disorder symptoms before age 15.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of borderline personality disorder?
questions.answer: Borderline personality disorder symptoms include unstable relationships, fear of abandonment, unstable self-image, impulsivity, self-harm, suicidal behavior, mood swings, chronic emptiness, inappropriate anger, paranoia or dissociation under stress.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of histrionic personality disorder?
questions.answer: Histrionic personality disorder symptoms include excessive emotionality, attention-seeking, provocative behavior, rapidly shifting emotions, theatrical speech, considers relationships more intimate than they are, easily influenced.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of narcissistic personality disorder?
questions.answer: Narcissistic personality disorder symptoms include grandiosity, need for admiration, lack of empathy, sense of entitlement, exploitative behavior, arrogant attitude, envious of others, believes others envious of them.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of avoidant personality disorder?
questions.answer: Avoidant personality disorder symptoms include social inhibition, feelings of inadequacy, hypersensitivity to criticism, avoids social situations, views self as inferior, reluctant to take risks, fears embarrassment.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of dependent personality disorder?
questions.answer: Dependent personality disorder symptoms include excessive need to be cared for, difficulty making decisions, needs reassurance, difficulty expressing disagreement, difficulty initiating projects, goes to excessive lengths to obtain support.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of obsessive-compulsive personality disorder?
questions.answer: Obsessive-compulsive personality disorder symptoms include preoccupation with orderliness, perfectionism, control, inflexibility, reluctance to delegate, overconscientious, hoards items, rigidity and stubbornness.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of dissociative amnesia?
questions.answer: Dissociative amnesia symptoms include inability to recall important personal information, memory gap too extensive to be ordinary forgetfulness, usually related to trauma or stress, and may have dissociative fugue (unexpected travel).

questions.question: What are the symptoms of dissociative identity disorder?
questions.answer: Dissociative identity disorder symptoms include two or more distinct personality states, gaps in memory, identity confusion, inability to recall personal information, depersonalization, derealization, and associated with severe trauma.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of depersonalization-derealization disorder?
questions.answer: Depersonalization-derealization disorder symptoms include feeling detached from self (depersonalization), feeling world is unreal (derealization), reality testing intact, emotional or physical numbness, and distress from symptoms.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of somatic symptom disorder?
questions.answer: Somatic symptom disorder symptoms include one or more distressing somatic symptoms, excessive thoughts about symptoms, high anxiety about health, excessive time and energy devoted to symptoms, lasting 6+ months.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of illness anxiety disorder?
questions.answer: Illness anxiety disorder symptoms include preoccupation with having serious illness, high anxiety about health, excessive health-related behaviors or avoidance, somatic symptoms absent or mild, lasting 6+ months.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of conversion disorder?
questions.answer: Conversion disorder symptoms include one or more neurological symptoms (weakness, paralysis, abnormal movements, seizures, speech problems), symptoms not compatible with medical condition, significant distress, and often follows stress.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of factitious disorder?
questions.answer: Factitious disorder symptoms include falsification of physical or psychological symptoms, presenting self as ill or impaired, deceptive behavior without obvious external rewards, and behavior persists even without external incentives.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of body dysmorphic disorder?
questions.answer: Body dysmorphic disorder symptoms include preoccupation with perceived defect in appearance, repetitive behaviors (mirror checking, excessive grooming), significant distress, comparison to others, and may avoid social situations.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of hoarding disorder?
questions.answer: Hoarding disorder symptoms include persistent difficulty discarding possessions, clutter preventing use of living spaces, distress at thought of discarding, functional impairment, and not due to another condition.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of trichotillomania?
questions.answer: Trichotillomania symptoms include recurrent hair pulling, noticeable hair loss, repeated attempts to stop, significant distress, tension before pulling, pleasure or relief during pulling, and may eat hair (trichophagia).

questions.question: What are the symptoms of excoriation disorder?
questions.answer: Excoriation disorder symptoms include recurrent skin picking, skin lesions, repeated attempts to stop, significant distress or impairment, tension before picking, pleasure or relief during picking, and not due to another condition.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of anorexia nervosa?
questions.answer: Anorexia nervosa symptoms include restricted food intake, significantly low body weight, intense fear of gaining weight, distorted body image, denial of low weight seriousness, and amenorrhea in females.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of bulimia nervosa?
questions.answer: Bulimia nervosa symptoms include recurrent binge eating, recurrent compensatory behaviors (vomiting, laxatives, exercise), self-evaluation influenced by body shape and weight, occurring at least weekly for 3 months.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of binge eating disorder?
questions.answer: Binge eating disorder symptoms include recurrent binge eating episodes, eating rapidly, eating until uncomfortable, eating large amounts when not hungry, eating alone due to embarrassment, distress about binge eating.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of avoidant/restrictive food intake disorder?
questions.answer: Avoidant/restrictive food intake disorder symptoms include avoidance or restriction of food intake, significant weight loss, nutritional deficiency, dependence on supplements, interference with functioning, and not due to body image concerns.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of pica?
questions.answer: Pica symptoms include persistent eating of non-nutritive substances (paper, soap, hair, dirt), lasting at least one month, not culturally appropriate, and may lead to medical complications like intestinal obstruction.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of rumination disorder?
questions.answer: Rumination disorder symptoms include repeated regurgitation of food, re-chewing, re-swallowing or spitting out, occurring for at least one month, not due to medical condition, and may lead to malnutrition.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of conduct disorder?
questions.answer: Conduct disorder symptoms include aggression to people and animals, destruction of property, deceitfulness or theft, serious rule violations, impaired functioning, lack of empathy, and onset in childhood or adolescence.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of oppositional defiant disorder?
questions.answer: Oppositional defiant disorder symptoms include angry/irritable mood, argumentative behavior, defiance, vindictiveness, occurring with at least one person who is not sibling, lasting 6+ months, and causing impairment.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of intermittent explosive disorder?
questions.answer: Intermittent explosive disorder symptoms include recurrent behavioral outbursts, verbal or physical aggression, aggression grossly disproportionate to situation, not premeditated, significant distress, and occurs at least twice weekly for 3 months.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of pyromania?
questions.answer: Pyromania symptoms include deliberate fire setting on multiple occasions, tension before setting fire, fascination with fire, pleasure or relief when setting fires, and not for monetary gain, ideology, or to conceal crime.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of kleptomania?
questions.answer: Kleptomania symptoms include recurrent failure to resist stealing, increasing tension before theft, pleasure or relief during theft, stealing not for personal use or monetary value, and not due to anger or delusion.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of intellectual disability?
questions.answer: Intellectual disability symptoms include deficits in intellectual functions (reasoning, problem-solving, learning), deficits in adaptive functioning, onset during developmental period, and varying levels of severity (mild to profound).

questions.question: What are the symptoms of global developmental delay?
questions.answer: Global developmental delay symptoms include failure to meet expected milestones in multiple areas (motor, language, cognitive, social), diagnosis under age 5, difficulty with assessment, and may later be diagnosed with specific disorder.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of specific learning disorder?
questions.answer: Specific learning disorder symptoms include difficulties with reading, writing, or mathematics, academic skills substantially below expected for age, problems present during school years, interferes with performance, and not due to other conditions.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of dyslexia?
questions.answer: Dyslexia symptoms include difficulty reading, slow reading, difficulty with word recognition, spelling problems, difficulty understanding what is read, avoidance of reading, and problems despite normal intelligence.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of dyscalculia?
questions.answer: Dyscalculia symptoms include difficulty understanding number concepts, difficulty with math facts, difficulty with calculations, difficulty with math reasoning, poor number sense, and problems despite normal intelligence.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of dysgraphia?
questions.answer: Dysgraphia symptoms include difficulty with handwriting, poor spelling, difficulty organizing thoughts on paper, inconsistent spacing, difficulty with written expression, slow writing, and problems despite normal intelligence.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of developmental coordination disorder?
questions.answer: Developmental coordination disorder symptoms include clumsiness, slow motor skills acquisition, difficulty with fine and gross motor tasks, poor balance, difficulty with sports, interference with daily activities, and onset in early childhood.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of stereotypic movement disorder?
questions.answer: Stereotypic movement disorder symptoms include repetitive purposeless movements (hand flapping, body rocking), movements interfere with activities or cause injury, onset in early developmental period, and not due to another condition.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of language disorder?
questions.answer: Language disorder symptoms include difficulty acquiring and using language, reduced vocabulary, limited sentence structure, difficulty with conversation, abilities below expected for age, onset in early developmental period, and interference with communication.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of speech sound disorder?
questions.answer: Speech sound disorder symptoms include difficulty with speech sound production, sounds omitted, substituted, or distorted, interferes with communication, below expected for age, onset in early developmental period, and not due to other conditions.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of childhood-onset fluency disorder?
questions.answer: Childhood-onset fluency disorder symptoms include stuttering, repetitions of sounds or syllables, sound prolongations, broken words, blocking, circumlocutions, excess tension, anxiety about speaking, and onset in early childhood.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of social communication disorder?
questions.answer: Social communication disorder symptoms include difficulty with social use of language, problems with greeting and sharing information, changing language for context, following conversation rules, understanding not explicitly stated, and functional limitations.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of reactive attachment disorder?
questions.answer: Reactive attachment disorder symptoms include emotionally withdrawn behavior toward caregivers, minimal seeking of comfort, minimal response to comfort, limited positive affect, irritability, sadness, fear, and pattern of insufficient care.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of disinhibited social engagement disorder?
questions.answer: Disinhibited social engagement disorder symptoms include approaching and interacting with unfamiliar adults, reduced reticence with strangers, overly familiar behavior, lack of checking with caregiver, willingness to go with strangers, and pattern of insufficient care.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of enuresis?
questions.answer: Enuresis symptoms include repeated urination into bed or clothes, occurring at least twice weekly for 3 months, chronological age at least 5 years, distress or impairment, and not due to substance or medical condition.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of encopresis?
questions.answer: Encopresis symptoms include repeated passage of feces in inappropriate places, occurring at least once monthly for 3 months, chronological age at least 4 years, and not due to substance or medical condition.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of substance intoxication?
questions.answer: Substance intoxication symptoms include reversible syndrome due to recent substance use, clinically significant behavioral or psychological changes, symptoms not due to medical condition, and varies by substance.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of substance withdrawal?
questions.answer: Substance withdrawal symptoms include syndrome following cessation of heavy prolonged use, clinically significant distress or impairment, symptoms not due to medical condition, and varies by substance.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of alcohol intoxication?
questions.answer: Alcohol intoxication symptoms include slurred speech, lack of coordination, unsteady gait, impaired attention or memory, stupor or coma, and recent alcohol use.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of alcohol withdrawal?
questions.answer: Alcohol withdrawal symptoms include autonomic hyperactivity, hand tremor, insomnia, nausea or vomiting, hallucinations, psychomotor agitation, anxiety, seizures, and develops within hours to days after stopping alcohol.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of delirium tremens?
questions.answer: Delirium tremens symptoms include severe confusion, hallucinations, severe agitation, fever, seizures, rapid heart rate, high blood pressure, profuse sweating, and life-threatening alcohol withdrawal.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of stimulant intoxication?
questions.answer: Stimulant intoxication symptoms include euphoria, increased energy, grandiosity, rapid speech, dilated pupils, elevated heart rate and blood pressure, agitation, paranoia, and recent stimulant use.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of stimulant withdrawal?
questions.answer: Stimulant withdrawal symptoms include dysphoric mood, fatigue, vivid unpleasant dreams, insomnia or hypersomnia, increased appetite, psychomotor agitation or retardation, and develops within hours to days after stopping.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of opioid intoxication?
questions.answer: Opioid intoxication symptoms include euphoria followed by apathy, psychomotor agitation or retardation, impaired judgment, constricted pupils, drowsiness, slurred speech, impaired attention, and recent opioid use.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of opioid withdrawal?
questions.answer: Opioid withdrawal symptoms include dysphoric mood, nausea or vomiting, muscle aches, tearing, runny nose, dilated pupils, sweating, diarrhea, yawning, fever, and insomnia.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of cannabis intoxication?
questions.answer: Cannabis intoxication symptoms include euphoria, anxiety, paranoid ideation, impaired judgment, red eyes, increased appetite, dry mouth, tachycardia, and recent cannabis use.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of cannabis withdrawal?
questions.answer: Cannabis withdrawal symptoms include irritability, anger, anxiety, difficulty sleeping, decreased appetite, restlessness, depressed mood, and physical symptoms (abdominal pain, tremor, sweating, fever, chills).

questions.question: What are the symptoms of hallucinogen intoxication?
questions.answer: Hallucinogen intoxication symptoms include marked perceptual changes, pupillary dilation, tachycardia, sweating, palpitations, blurred vision, tremors, lack of coordination, anxiety, paranoid ideation, and recent hallucinogen use.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of sedative/hypnotic withdrawal?
questions.answer: Sedative/hypnotic withdrawal symptoms include autonomic hyperactivity, hand tremor, insomnia, nausea or vomiting, hallucinations, psychomotor agitation, anxiety, seizures, and potentially life-threatening.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of serotonin syndrome?
questions.answer: Serotonin syndrome symptoms include agitation, confusion, rapid heart rate, high blood pressure, dilated pupils, muscle rigidity, tremor, sweating, diarrhea, headache, shivering, and potentially life-threatening.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of neuroleptic malignant syndrome?
questions.answer: Neuroleptic malignant syndrome symptoms include severe muscle rigidity, high fever, altered mental status, autonomic instability (blood pressure and heart rate changes), sweating, elevated creatine kinase, and potentially fatal.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of malignant hyperthermia?
questions.answer: Malignant hyperthermia symptoms include rapid rise in body temperature, muscle rigidity, rapid heart rate, rapid breathing, increased CO2 production, muscle breakdown, dark urine, and triggered by anesthesia.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of anticholinergic toxicity?
questions.answer: Anticholinergic toxicity symptoms include confusion, agitation, hallucinations, dilated pupils, blurred vision, flushed skin, fever, dry mouth, urinary retention, decreased bowel sounds, and tachycardia.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of cholinergic toxicity?
questions.answer: Cholinergic toxicity symptoms include salivation, lacrimation, urination, defecation, muscle weakness, muscle fasciculations, bradycardia, constricted pupils, confusion, seizures, and respiratory failure.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of lithium toxicity?
questions.answer: Lithium toxicity symptoms include tremor, confusion, slurred speech, muscle weakness, nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, increased reflexes, ataxia, seizures, and potentially irreversible neurological damage.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of benzodiazepine toxicity?
questions.answer: Benzodiazepine toxicity symptoms include drowsiness, confusion, slurred speech, poor coordination, respiratory depression, loss of consciousness, and potentially fatal when combined with other depressants.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of barbiturate toxicity?
questions.answer: Barbiturate toxicity symptoms include drowsiness, confusion, slurred speech, lack of coordination, respiratory depression, low blood pressure, hypothermia, coma, and potentially fatal.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of lead poisoning?
questions.answer: Lead poisoning symptoms include developmental delays in children, learning difficulties, irritability, loss of appetite, weight loss, abdominal pain, vomiting, constipation, fatigue, and peripheral neuropathy in adults.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of mercury poisoning?
questions.answer: Mercury poisoning symptoms include tremor, insomnia, memory loss, muscle weakness, numbness or tingling, vision and hearing problems, difficulty walking, mood changes, and kidney problems.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of arsenic poisoning?
questions.answer: Arsenic poisoning symptoms include nausea, vomiting, abdominal pain, diarrhea, numbness and tingling in extremities, muscle cramps, confusion, seizures, and white lines on fingernails.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of carbon monoxide poisoning?
questions.answer: Carbon monoxide poisoning symptoms include headache, dizziness, nausea, confusion, shortness of breath, loss of consciousness, seizures, cherry-red skin, and potentially fatal.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of organophosphate poisoning?
questions.answer: Organophosphate poisoning symptoms include excessive salivation, tearing, sweating, muscle twitching, weakness, nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, constricted pupils, confusion, seizures, and respiratory failure.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of botulism?
questions.answer: Botulism symptoms include blurred or double vision, drooping eyelids, slurred speech, difficulty swallowing, dry mouth, muscle weakness descending from head, paralysis, respiratory failure, and potentially fatal.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of tetanus?
questions.answer: Tetanus symptoms include jaw cramping (lockjaw), muscle stiffness, difficulty swallowing, painful muscle spasms, fever, sweating, elevated blood pressure, rapid heart rate, and potentially fatal.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of rabies?
questions.answer: Rabies symptoms include fever, headache, anxiety, confusion, agitation, hallucinations, hydrophobia (fear of water), excessive salivation, difficulty swallowing, paralysis, and nearly always fatal once symptoms appear.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of polio?
questions.answer: Polio symptoms include fever, fatigue, headache, muscle stiffness, neck stiffness, limb pain, muscle weakness, paralysis (in severe cases), and post-polio syndrome may develop years later.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of West Nile virus?
questions.answer: West Nile virus symptoms include fever, headache, body aches, joint pain, vomiting, diarrhea, rash, and severe cases may have neck stiffness, confusion, tremors, seizures, paralysis, or coma.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of Zika virus?
questions.answer: Zika virus symptoms include fever, rash, joint pain, red eyes, muscle pain, headache, and in pregnant women can cause birth defects (microcephaly) and neurological complications (Guillain-Barré syndrome).

questions.question: What are the symptoms of Japanese encephalitis?
questions.answer: Japanese encephalitis symptoms include fever, headache, vomiting, confusion, difficulty moving, seizures, coma, and severe cases can cause permanent brain damage or death.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of tick-borne encephalitis?
questions.answer: Tick-borne encephalitis symptoms include fever, headache, fatigue, muscle pain, nausea, followed by neurological symptoms including confusion, seizures, paralysis, and coma in severe cases.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of Lyme disease?
questions.answer: Lyme disease symptoms include bullseye rash (erythema migrans), fever, chills, fatigue, headache, muscle and joint aches, and later stages may include facial palsy, arthritis, heart problems, and neurological symptoms.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of neurosyphilis?
questions.answer: Neurosyphilis symptoms include headache, altered behavior, difficulty coordinating movements, paralysis, sensory deficits, dementia, vision problems, and may occur years after initial infection.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of HIV-associated dementia?
questions.answer: HIV-associated dementia symptoms include memory loss, difficulty concentrating, slowed thinking, confusion, behavioral changes, motor difficulties, apathy, social withdrawal, and occurs in advanced HIV infection.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of progressive multifocal leukoencephalopathy?
questions.answer: Progressive multifocal leukoencephalopathy symptoms include weakness, clumsiness, vision problems, personality changes, speech difficulties, cognitive impairment, seizures, and progresses rapidly in immunocompromised individuals.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of subacute sclerosing panencephalitis?
questions.answer: Subacute sclerosing panencephalitis symptoms include behavioral changes, memory loss, myoclonic jerks, seizures, difficulty walking, blindness, coma, and rare late complication of measles infection.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of cerebral malaria?
questions.answer: Cerebral malaria symptoms include fever, headache, confusion, seizures, altered consciousness, coma, neurological deficits, and potentially fatal complication of malaria infection.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of toxoplasmosis?
questions.answer: Toxoplasmosis symptoms in immunocompromised include headache, confusion, seizures, fever, weakness, speech problems, vision problems, and can cause severe brain infection.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of cytomegalovirus encephalitis?
questions.answer: Cytomegalovirus encephalitis symptoms include confusion, altered consciousness, seizures, focal neurological deficits, cranial nerve palsies, and occurs primarily in immunocompromised patients.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of herpes simplex encephalitis?
questions.answer: Herpes simplex encephalitis symptoms include fever, headache, seizures, altered consciousness, personality changes, speech problems, weakness, hallucinations, and medical emergency requiring immediate treatment.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of varicella zoster encephalitis?
questions.answer: Varicella zoster encephalitis symptoms include headache, fever, altered consciousness, seizures, focal neurological deficits, and may occur with or after shingles rash.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of Epstein-Barr virus encephalitis?
questions.answer: Epstein-Barr virus encephalitis symptoms include fever, headache, altered consciousness, seizures, focal neurological signs, and rare complication of mononucleosis infection.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of enterovirus encephalitis?
questions.answer: Enterovirus encephalitis symptoms include fever, headache, nausea, vomiting, altered consciousness, seizures, weakness or paralysis, and more common in children.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of mumps encephalitis?
questions.answer: Mumps encephalitis symptoms include fever, headache, neck stiffness, altered consciousness, seizures, occurs during or after mumps infection, and usually has good prognosis.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of measles encephalitis?
questions.answer: Measles encephalitis symptoms include fever, headache, seizures, altered consciousness, coma, occurs during measles infection, and can cause permanent brain damage or death.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of bacterial meningitis?
questions.answer: Bacterial meningitis symptoms include sudden high fever, severe headache, stiff neck, nausea and vomiting, confusion, sensitivity to light, rash (in meningococcal), and medical emergency.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of viral meningitis?
questions.answer: Viral meningitis symptoms include fever, headache, stiff neck, nausea and vomiting, sensitivity to light, lack of appetite, lethargy, and usually less severe than bacterial meningitis.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of fungal meningitis?
questions.answer: Fungal meningitis symptoms include headache, fever, neck stiffness, nausea and vomiting, sensitivity to light, confusion, develops slowly, and occurs primarily in immunocompromised individuals.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of tuberculous meningitis?
questions.answer: Tuberculous meningitis symptoms include gradual onset headache, fever, neck stiffness, confusion, vision problems, cranial nerve palsies, seizures, and requires prolonged treatment.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of cryptococcal meningitis?
questions.answer: Cryptococcal meningitis symptoms include headache, fever, neck stiffness, nausea and vomiting, sensitivity to light, confusion, personality changes, and primarily affects immunocompromised patients.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of aseptic meningitis?
questions.answer: Aseptic meningitis symptoms include headache, fever, neck stiffness, nausea and vomiting, sensitivity to light, no bacterial cause found, usually viral, and typically has good prognosis.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of carcinomatous meningitis?
questions.answer: Carcinomatous meningitis symptoms include headache, confusion, nausea and vomiting, cranial nerve palsies, weakness, sensory changes, and caused by cancer spreading to meninges.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of chemical meningitis?
questions.answer: Chemical meningitis symptoms include severe headache, neck stiffness, fever, altered consciousness, caused by irritation from blood, medications, or contrast agents in CSF.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of recurrent meningitis?
questions.answer: Recurrent meningitis symptoms include multiple episodes of meningitis symptoms (headache, fever, neck stiffness), may indicate CSF leak, immune deficiency, or anatomical abnormality.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of spinal epidural abscess?
questions.answer: Spinal epidural abscess symptoms include back pain, fever, neurological deficits (weakness, numbness), bladder or bowel dysfunction, and medical emergency requiring prompt treatment.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of spinal subdural empyema?
questions.answer: Spinal subdural empyema symptoms include back pain, fever, rapidly progressive weakness, sensory loss, bladder and bowel dysfunction, and rare but serious infection.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of transverse myelitis?
questions.answer: Transverse myelitis symptoms include weakness in legs or arms, numbness or tingling, sharp back pain, bladder and bowel dysfunction, muscle spasms, and inflammation across width of spinal cord.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of acute flaccid myelitis?
questions.answer: Acute flaccid myelitis symptoms include sudden weakness in arms or legs, loss of muscle tone, loss of reflexes, facial drooping, difficulty swallowing, slurred speech, and often follows viral illness.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of spinal cord compression?
questions.answer: Spinal cord compression symptoms include back pain, weakness, numbness, difficulty walking, loss of coordination, bladder or bowel problems, and requires urgent evaluation and treatment.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of spinal cord infarction?
questions.answer: Spinal cord infarction symptoms include sudden back pain, weakness or paralysis below level of infarction, numbness, loss of bladder and bowel control, and caused by interrupted blood supply.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of anterior spinal artery syndrome?
questions.answer: Anterior spinal artery syndrome symptoms include sudden weakness or paralysis, loss of pain and temperature sensation, preserved position and vibration sense, bladder and bowel dysfunction.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of central cord syndrome?
questions.answer: Central cord syndrome symptoms include greater weakness in arms than legs, sensory loss, bladder dysfunction, caused by injury to central spinal cord, and often improves with time.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of Brown-Sequard syndrome?
questions.answer: Brown-Sequard syndrome symptoms include weakness on one side of body, loss of position sense on same side, loss of pain and temperature sensation on opposite side, caused by hemisection of spinal cord.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of conus medullaris syndrome?
questions.answer: Conus medullaris syndrome symptoms include sudden onset bladder and bowel dysfunction, saddle anesthesia, symmetric motor weakness in legs, back pain, and injury to end of spinal cord.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of cervical spondylotic myelopathy?
questions.answer: Cervical spondylotic myelopathy symptoms include neck pain, difficulty walking, hand clumsiness, weakness in arms or legs, numbness, bladder problems, and caused by spinal cord compression from arthritis.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of lumbar spinal stenosis?
questions.answer: Lumbar spinal stenosis symptoms include back pain, leg pain or cramping with walking (neurogenic claudication), numbness or weakness in legs, symptoms improve when bending forward, and difficulty standing.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of cervical radiculopathy?
questions.answer: Cervical radiculopathy symptoms include neck pain, radiating pain into arm, numbness or tingling in arm or hand, weakness in arm, loss of reflexes, and caused by nerve root compression.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of lumbar radiculopathy?
questions.answer: Lumbar radiculopathy symptoms include back pain, radiating pain into leg (sciatica), numbness or tingling in leg or foot, weakness in leg, loss of reflexes, and caused by nerve root compression.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of herniated disc?
questions.answer: Herniated disc symptoms include localized back or neck pain, radiating pain into arm or leg, numbness or tingling, weakness, pain worsens with certain movements, and caused by disc material pressing on nerves.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of spinal stenosis?
questions.answer: Spinal stenosis symptoms include back pain, leg pain with walking, numbness or weakness in legs, cramping, balance problems, symptoms improve with rest or bending forward, and narrowing of spinal canal.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of spondylolisthesis?
questions.answer: Spondylolisthesis symptoms include lower back pain, muscle spasms, leg pain, numbness or tingling in legs, weakness, difficulty walking, and vertebra slips forward over another vertebra.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of spinal cord tumor?
questions.answer: Spinal cord tumor symptoms include back pain, weakness, numbness, difficulty walking, loss of coordination, bladder or bowel problems, and symptoms progress gradually.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of tethered cord syndrome?
questions.answer: Tethered cord syndrome symptoms include back pain, leg weakness, numbness, foot deformities, scoliosis, bladder and bowel problems, and spinal cord abnormally attached preventing normal movement.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of spina bifida?
questions.answer: Spina bifida symptoms vary by type, including visible opening in spine, weakness or paralysis in legs, bladder and bowel problems, hydrocephalus, learning disabilities, and present at birth.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of arachnoiditis?
questions.answer: Arachnoiditis symptoms include chronic severe pain in back and legs, numbness, tingling, burning sensations, muscle cramps, muscle spasms, bladder and bowel problems, and caused by inflammation of arachnoid membrane.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of empty sella syndrome?
questions.answer: Empty sella syndrome symptoms include headaches, vision problems, hormone imbalances, and often asymptomatic, CSF fills space normally occupied by pituitary gland.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of pineal cyst?
questions.answer: Pineal cyst symptoms include headaches, vision problems, difficulty looking upward (Parinaud syndrome), hydrocephalus symptoms if cyst blocks CSF flow, and often asymptomatic.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of colloid cyst?
questions.answer: Colloid cyst symptoms include headaches, memory problems, behavioral changes, sudden severe headache, loss of consciousness, drop attacks, and can cause sudden death if blocks CSF flow.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of arachnoid cyst?
questions.answer: Arachnoid cyst symptoms include headaches, seizures, developmental delays, balance problems, vision problems, nausea, and many are asymptomatic, CSF-filled sac between brain and arachnoid membrane.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of dermoid cyst?
questions.answer: Dermoid cyst symptoms include headaches, seizures, symptoms depending on location, may rupture causing aseptic meningitis, and contains skin cells and hair follicles.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of epidermoid cyst?
questions.answer: Epidermoid cyst symptoms include headaches, seizures, cranial nerve dysfunction, symptoms depending on location, slow-growing, and contains skin cells.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of Rathke's cleft cyst?
questions.answer: Rathke's cleft cyst symptoms include headaches, vision problems, hormone imbalances, often asymptomatic, and benign cyst between parts of pituitary gland.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of craniopharyngioma?
questions.answer: Craniopharyngioma symptoms include headaches, vision problems, growth delays, hormone imbalances, fatigue, weight gain, and benign tumor near pituitary gland.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of choroid plexus papilloma?
questions.answer: Choroid plexus papilloma symptoms include headaches, nausea and vomiting, hydrocephalus symptoms, developmental delays in children, and benign tumor that produces excess CSF.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of hemangioblastoma?
questions.answer: Hemangioblastoma symptoms include headaches, balance problems, nausea and vomiting, ataxia, and benign tumor often in cerebellum, may be associated with von Hippel-Lindau disease.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of schwannoma?
questions.answer: Schwannoma symptoms depend on location, including hearing loss (acoustic neuroma), facial weakness, numbness, pain, and benign tumor of nerve sheath cells.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of neurofibroma?
questions.answer: Neurofibroma symptoms include soft lumps under skin, pain or tenderness, numbness or tingling if pressing on nerves, and benign tumor of nerve tissue, associated with neurofibromatosis.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of ganglioglioma?
questions.answer: Ganglioglioma symptoms include seizures, headaches, neurological deficits depending on location, and rare slow-growing tumor containing neurons and glial cells.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of dysembryoplastic neuroepithelial tumor?
questions.answer: Dysembryoplastic neuroepithelial tumor symptoms include seizures (often starting in childhood), headaches, and benign slow-growing tumor typically in temporal lobe.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of central neurocytoma?
questions.answer: Central neurocytoma symptoms include headaches, nausea and vomiting, hydrocephalus symptoms, vision problems, and rare benign tumor in ventricles.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of subependymoma?
questions.answer: Subependymoma symptoms include headaches, nausea and vomiting, hydrocephalus symptoms, often asymptomatic, and benign slow-growing tumor in ventricles.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of astrocytoma?
questions.answer: Astrocytoma symptoms include headaches, seizures, personality changes, weakness, speech difficulties, vision problems, and symptoms vary by grade (I-IV) and location.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of anaplastic astrocytoma?
questions.answer: Anaplastic astrocytoma symptoms include headaches, seizures, personality changes, cognitive decline, weakness, speech problems, and grade III malignant tumor.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of diffuse intrinsic pontine glioma?
questions.answer: Diffuse intrinsic pontine glioma symptoms include double vision, difficulty with eye movements, facial weakness, difficulty swallowing, difficulty walking, weakness in limbs, and aggressive childhood brain tumor.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of brain metastases?
questions.answer: Brain metastases symptoms include headaches, seizures, weakness, numbness, personality changes, speech difficulties, vision problems, and cancer spread from another body part to brain.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of leptomeningeal metastases?
questions.answer: Leptomeningeal metastases symptoms include headache, nausea and vomiting, cranial nerve palsies, confusion, seizures, weakness, back pain, and cancer spread to meninges.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of primary CNS lymphoma?
questions.answer: Primary CNS lymphoma symptoms include headache, confusion, personality changes, seizures, weakness, speech problems, vision problems, and lymphoma originating in brain or spinal cord.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of germinoma?
questions.answer: Germinoma symptoms include headaches, vision problems, hormone imbalances, diabetes insipidus, delayed puberty, and rare tumor often in pineal or suprasellar region.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of teratoma?
questions.answer: Teratoma symptoms include headaches, hydrocephalus, seizures, symptoms vary by location, and tumor containing different tissue types, can be benign or malignant.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of chordoma?
questions.answer: Chordoma symptoms include headaches, double vision, difficulty swallowing, facial numbness, back or neck pain, and rare bone tumor at skull base or spine.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of chondrosarcoma?
questions.answer: Chondrosarcoma symptoms include headaches, vision problems, cranial nerve palsies, pain, and cartilage tumor often at skull base.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of hemangiopericytoma?
questions.answer: Hemangiopericytoma symptoms include headaches, seizures, focal neurological deficits, and rare tumor of blood vessel walls in meninges.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of atypical meningioma?
questions.answer: Atypical meningioma symptoms include headaches, seizures, weakness, vision problems, personality changes, and more aggressive than typical meningioma with higher recurrence rate.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of anaplastic meningioma?
questions.answer: Anaplastic meningioma symptoms include headaches, seizures, focal neurological deficits, rapid symptom progression, and malignant meningioma with poor prognosis.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of radiation necrosis?
questions.answer: Radiation necrosis symptoms include headaches, seizures, focal neurological deficits, cognitive decline, personality changes, and dead brain tissue from radiation therapy, mimics tumor recurrence.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of radiation-induced brain tumor?
questions.answer: Radiation-induced brain tumor symptoms include headaches, seizures, neurological deficits, and new tumor developing years after radiation therapy to head.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of chemotherapy-induced neuropathy?
questions.answer: Chemotherapy-induced neuropathy symptoms include numbness and tingling in hands and feet, burning or shooting pain, sensitivity to cold, loss of balance, difficulty with fine motor tasks.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of posterior reversible encephalopathy syndrome?
questions.answer: Posterior reversible encephalopathy syndrome symptoms include headache, seizures, vision changes, confusion, altered consciousness, high blood pressure, and usually reversible with treatment.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of osmotic demyelination syndrome?
questions.answer: Osmotic demyelination syndrome symptoms include confusion, difficulty speaking, difficulty swallowing, weakness in arms and legs, behavioral changes, and caused by rapid correction of low sodium.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of Marchiafava-Bignami disease?
questions.answer: Marchiafava-Bignami disease symptoms include confusion, impaired consciousness, seizures, paralysis, dementia, and rare disorder causing degeneration of corpus callosum, associated with chronic alcoholism.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of vitamin B12 deficiency?
questions.answer: Vitamin B12 deficiency symptoms include fatigue, weakness, numbness or tingling in hands and feet, difficulty walking, memory problems, confusion, depression, pale skin, smooth tongue, and can cause permanent nerve damage if untreated.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of vitamin B1 deficiency?
questions.answer: Vitamin B1 deficiency symptoms include fatigue, irritability, muscle weakness, numbness or tingling, confusion, memory problems, poor coordination, and severe deficiency causes beriberi or Wernicke-Korsakoff syndrome.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of vitamin B6 deficiency?
questions.answer: Vitamin B6 deficiency symptoms include peripheral neuropathy, depression, confusion, weakened immune function, anemia, dermatitis, inflamed tongue, and seizures in severe cases.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of vitamin E deficiency?
questions.answer: Vitamin E deficiency symptoms include muscle weakness, difficulty walking, tremor, vision problems, numbness or tingling, immune system impairment, and rare except in malabsorption disorders.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of folate deficiency?
questions.answer: Folate deficiency symptoms include fatigue, weakness, pale skin, shortness of breath, irritability, difficulty concentrating, headache, mouth sores, and can cause neural tube defects in pregnancy.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of copper deficiency?
questions.answer: Copper deficiency symptoms include anemia, neutropenia, bone abnormalities, neurological problems (numbness, weakness, difficulty walking), and myelopathy similar to B12 deficiency.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of vitamin D deficiency?
questions.answer: Vitamin D deficiency symptoms include bone pain, muscle weakness, fatigue, depression, frequent infections, and can contribute to osteoporosis and increased fracture risk.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of magnesium deficiency?
questions.answer: Magnesium deficiency symptoms include muscle cramps, tremor, weakness, numbness or tingling, personality changes, abnormal heart rhythms, seizures, and often occurs with other electrolyte imbalances.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of calcium deficiency?
questions.answer: Calcium deficiency symptoms include muscle cramps, numbness or tingling in fingers, abnormal heart rhythms, seizures, dental problems, brittle nails, and osteoporosis with long-term deficiency.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of potassium deficiency?
questions.answer: Potassium deficiency symptoms include muscle weakness, muscle cramps, fatigue, constipation, abnormal heart rhythms, paralysis in severe cases, and respiratory problems.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of sodium deficiency?
questions.answer: Sodium deficiency symptoms include nausea, vomiting, headache, confusion, fatigue, irritability, muscle cramps, seizures, coma in severe cases, and called hyponatremia.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of iron deficiency?
questions.answer: Iron deficiency symptoms include fatigue, weakness, pale skin, shortness of breath, dizziness, cold hands and feet, brittle nails, unusual cravings (pica), and restless leg syndrome.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of zinc deficiency?
questions.answer: Zinc deficiency symptoms include hair loss, diarrhea, delayed wound healing, loss of appetite, altered sense of taste and smell, skin lesions, impaired immune function, and growth retardation in children.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of selenium deficiency?
questions.answer: Selenium deficiency symptoms include fatigue, mental fog, weakened immune system, infertility, muscle weakness, hair loss, and severe deficiency can cause Keshan disease (heart disorder).

questions.question: What are the symptoms of iodine deficiency?
questions.answer: Iodine deficiency symptoms include goiter (enlarged thyroid), hypothyroidism symptoms (fatigue, weight gain, cold intolerance), difficulty swallowing, intellectual disability if severe in childhood.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of hypothyroidism?
questions.answer: Hypothyroidism symptoms include fatigue, weight gain, cold intolerance, dry skin, hair loss, constipation, depression, memory problems, slowed heart rate, and muscle weakness.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of hyperthyroidism?
questions.answer: Hyperthyroidism symptoms include weight loss, rapid heart rate, anxiety, tremor, sweating, heat intolerance, frequent bowel movements, difficulty sleeping, and bulging eyes (in Graves' disease).

questions.question: What are the symptoms of Hashimoto's thyroiditis?
questions.answer: Hashimoto's thyroiditis symptoms include fatigue, weight gain, constipation, dry skin, depression, muscle aches, enlarged thyroid (goiter), and autoimmune condition causing hypothyroidism.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of Graves' disease?
questions.answer: Graves' disease symptoms include weight loss, rapid heartbeat, anxiety, tremor, sweating, enlarged thyroid, bulging eyes (exophthalmos), and autoimmune condition causing hyperthyroidism.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of thyroid storm?
questions.answer: Thyroid storm symptoms include very high fever, rapid heart rate, agitation, confusion, delirium, nausea, vomiting, diarrhea, and life-threatening complication of severe hyperthyroidism.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of myxedema coma?
questions.answer: Myxedema coma symptoms include decreased consciousness, hypothermia, low blood pressure, slow breathing, low blood sugar, and life-threatening complication of severe hypothyroidism.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of adrenal insufficiency?
questions.answer: Adrenal insufficiency symptoms include fatigue, muscle weakness, weight loss, low blood pressure, darkening of skin (in Addison's disease), salt craving, nausea, diarrhea, and dizziness.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of Addison's disease?
questions.answer: Addison's disease symptoms include chronic fatigue, muscle weakness, weight loss, low blood pressure, hyperpigmentation (darkened skin), salt craving, nausea, diarrhea, and depression.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of Cushing's syndrome?
questions.answer: Cushing's syndrome symptoms include weight gain (especially face, upper back, and abdomen), purple stretch marks, easy bruising, muscle weakness, high blood pressure, diabetes, mood changes, and excess cortisol.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of pheochromocytoma?
questions.answer: Pheochromocytoma symptoms include episodes of severe high blood pressure, rapid heartbeat, severe headaches, sweating, tremor, pale face, anxiety, and tumor producing excess catecholamines.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of acromegaly?
questions.answer: Acromegaly symptoms include enlarged hands and feet, facial changes (prominent jaw and forehead), deepened voice, joint pain, excessive sweating, headaches, vision problems, and excess growth hormone.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of diabetes insipidus?
questions.answer: Diabetes insipidus symptoms include extreme thirst, excessive urination (especially at night), dilute urine, dehydration, fatigue, irritability, and caused by deficiency of or resistance to ADH hormone.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of SIADH?
questions.answer: SIADH symptoms include nausea, vomiting, headache, confusion, seizures, decreased urine output, weight gain without edema, and syndrome of inappropriate antidiuretic hormone causing low sodium.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of hyperparathyroidism?
questions.answer: Hyperparathyroidism symptoms include kidney stones, bone pain, osteoporosis, fatigue, weakness, depression, memory problems, abdominal pain, nausea, and excess parathyroid hormone causing high calcium.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of hypoparathyroidism?
questions.answer: Hypoparathyroidism symptoms include muscle cramps, tingling in lips, fingers and toes, dry skin, brittle nails, seizures, dental problems, cataracts, and low parathyroid hormone causing low calcium.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of hypercalcemia?
questions.answer: Hypercalcemia symptoms include fatigue, weakness, nausea, vomiting, constipation, confusion, memory problems, depression, kidney stones, bone pain, and excessive calcium in blood.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of hypocalcemia?
questions.answer: Hypocalcemia symptoms include muscle cramps, numbness or tingling in fingers and toes, muscle spasms (tetany), seizures, abnormal heart rhythms, confusion, and low calcium in blood.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of hyperkalemia?
questions.answer: Hyperkalemia symptoms include muscle weakness, fatigue, nausea, abnormal heart rhythms (potentially fatal), numbness or tingling, and high potassium in blood.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of hypokalemia?
questions.answer: Hypokalemia symptoms include muscle weakness, muscle cramps, fatigue, constipation, abnormal heart rhythms, paralysis in severe cases, and low potassium in blood.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of hypernatremia?
questions.answer: Hypernatremia symptoms include thirst, confusion, irritability, muscle twitching, seizures, altered consciousness, and high sodium in blood causing dehydration.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of hyperglycemia?
questions.answer: Hyperglycemia symptoms include increased thirst, frequent urination, blurred vision, fatigue, headache, difficulty concentrating, and high blood sugar in diabetes.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of hypoglycemia?
questions.answer: Hypoglycemia symptoms include shakiness, sweating, rapid heartbeat, anxiety, hunger, irritability, confusion, blurred vision, weakness, seizures, loss of consciousness, and low blood sugar.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of diabetic ketoacidosis?
questions.answer: Diabetic ketoacidosis symptoms include excessive thirst, frequent urination, nausea, vomiting, abdominal pain, weakness, shortness of breath, fruity-scented breath, confusion, and life-threatening complication of diabetes.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of hyperosmolar hyperglycemic state?
questions.answer: Hyperosmolar hyperglycemic state symptoms include extremely high blood sugar, severe dehydration, confusion, vision problems, hallucinations, seizures, coma, and life-threatening diabetes complication.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of type 1 diabetes?
questions.answer: Type 1 diabetes symptoms include increased thirst, frequent urination, extreme hunger, weight loss, fatigue, blurred vision, slow-healing sores, and autoimmune destruction of insulin-producing cells.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of type 2 diabetes?
questions.answer: Type 2 diabetes symptoms include increased thirst, frequent urination, increased hunger, fatigue, blurred vision, slow-healing sores, frequent infections, darkened skin areas, and insulin resistance.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of gestational diabetes?
questions.answer: Gestational diabetes symptoms include increased thirst, frequent urination, fatigue, nausea, blurred vision, occurs during pregnancy, and usually resolves after delivery but increases future diabetes risk.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of prediabetes?
questions.answer: Prediabetes symptoms often none, but may include darkened skin areas, increased thirst, frequent urination, fatigue, and blood sugar higher than normal but not yet diabetes level.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of diabetic neuropathy complications?
questions.answer: Diabetic neuropathy complications include loss of sensation in feet leading to injuries, foot ulcers, infections, Charcot foot (bone deformities), digestive problems, bladder dysfunction, and erectile dysfunction.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of diabetic retinopathy?
questions.answer: Diabetic retinopathy symptoms include blurred vision, floaters, dark areas in vision, difficulty with color perception, vision loss, and diabetes complication damaging blood vessels in retina.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of diabetic nephropathy?
questions.answer: Diabetic nephropathy symptoms include swelling in legs, ankles, feet, fatigue, nausea, vomiting, loss of appetite, difficulty concentrating, and diabetes complication causing kidney damage.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of metabolic syndrome?
questions.answer: Metabolic syndrome symptoms include large waist circumference, high blood pressure, high blood sugar, high triglycerides, low HDL cholesterol, and cluster of conditions increasing heart disease and diabetes risk.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of polycystic ovary syndrome?
questions.answer: Polycystic ovary syndrome symptoms include irregular periods, excess hair growth, acne, male-pattern baldness, weight gain, insulin resistance, difficulty getting pregnant, and hormonal disorder.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of menopause?
questions.answer: Menopause symptoms include hot flashes, night sweats, irregular periods, vaginal dryness, mood changes, difficulty sleeping, weight gain, thinning hair, and natural decline in reproductive hormones.

questions.question: What are the symptoms of testosterone deficiency?
questions.answer: Testosterone deficiency symptoms include decreased sex drive, erectile dysfunction, fatigue, loss of muscle mass, increased body fat, mood changes, difficulty concentrating, and low testosterone (hypogonadism).

questions.question: What are the symptoms of growth hormone deficiency?
